titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Josiah Dikeman papers 1977.299
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:18:51 +0000.

did.abstract: The Josiah Dikeman papers span the period 1790 to 1819 include an account book, dated 1780 to 1790; an account book for the sale of household goods, dated 1819; and forty-six receipts for tailor work, household goods, and medicine, dated 1785 to 1820. On many documents in the collection, Dikeman's last name is alternately spelled Dykeman and Diteman.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Josiah Dikeman papers, 1977.299, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Josiah Dikeman papers span the period 1790 to 1819 and measure 0.1 linear feet. The papers include an account book, dated 1780 to 1790; an account book for the sale of household goods, dated 1819; and forty-six receipts for tailor work, household goods, and medicine, dated 1785 to 1820. On many documents in the collection, Dikeman's last name is alternately spelled Dykeman and Diteman.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Josiah Dikeman (circa 1759-1819) was a resident of Brooklyn. He is listed in an 1811 Brooklyn Directory as a tailor who lived on Liberty Street.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The papers were formally accessioned in 1977.
